results.title: Sacred sites
results.creator_credit: Richard Guthrie, Commonwealth Dept of Aboriginal Affairs and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Rainbow serpent”.
Bob Maza narrates this exploration of the Australian Aborigine’s relationship to his sacred sites. Several sites are visited with their guardians who explain the importance of maintaining the sites and protecting them from the tourist, mining and agricultural industries. Sites visited include, Merella Cave, W.A., Uluru, Alice Springs, Guru Guru Cave, W.A. and Milbrodale, N.S.W. There are also extensive interviews with Charles Perkins.

results.title: Rolf Harris' water safety
results.creator_credit: Jessica Skippon and Rolf Harris Video Productions
results.brief_description: A water safety program featuring Rolf Harris and four children, aimed at children up to about twelve years of age. The tape is divided into three sections. 1. Spot the danger (15 mins.) 2. Boating and falling into cold water (17 mins.) 3. Reach throw wade row and rescue breathing (24 mins.)

results.title: Rolf Harris: How to Draw Fun Cartoons
results.brief_description: Yes, it’s the distinctive cartoons, drawings and humour of the unstoppable Rolf Harris and it’s Rolf Harris in person taking you through your very own “learn to draw” lesson. “You can draw”, says Rolf Harris. “We all can. It’s just a matter of knowing that you can draw your way”. How to draw fun cartoons, will give you as much pleasure watching as it will when you try out Rolf’s methods for yourself. Don’t say “I can’t draw” anymore, let Rolf Harris show you how.

results.title: Running out of patience
results.brief_description: In October 1986, Victorian nurses began an historic strike action which was to last 50 days. This video is the nurses version of the dispute. Despite widespread condemnation mainly from the media, the nurses eventually won out for an appropriate career structure including significant pay increases. Actual strike footage together with nursing training films and old photographs explore vocational stereotypes and place the strike in the context of the current crisis in the health care system.

results.title: Signatures of the Soul
results.brief_description: Counter-cultural icon Peter Fonda takes us on a comprehensive journey through the world of tattooing. From early tribal origins and eastern influences, right through to adoption in the mainstream and gradual acceptance as an art form, tattooing has been elevated to both art and an intense form of self-expression.

results.title: A Phoenix rising
results.brief_description: A documentary film showing how the community of Mt. Macedon is piecing together its life again after being annihilated by the fires of Ash Wednesday. The film is based on interviews with some of the residents and gives case studies of a couple of families. Written and narrated by John Bonney.
results.description: A documentary film showing how the community of Mt. Macedon is piecing together its life again after being annihilated by the fires of Ash Wednesday. results.title: Static generation
results.creator_credit: Monash University and Mobil Oil Australia
results.brief_description:
This 1980 film demonstrates the importance of using a static wire when transferring petrol and other flammable liquids. The instructional film uses an animation to explain how electric charges build up on the surface of the petrol as it is being transferred, and if there is no static wire to earth the charges, an explosion will occur. The film then shows footage of petrol tankers being filled, while earthed with a static wire, and small test runs of petrol being transferred from bucket to bucket, and the static charge that results. It also includes footage of a large explosion, indicating the severity of not following the procedure.

Produced by Mobil Oil Australia in conjunction with the Department of Chemical Engineering, Monash University.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: A Puppet pudding
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, David Perry, Michael Creighton and Marionette Theatre of Australia
results.brief_description: An introduction to the world of Norman Lindsay’s classic Australian children’s story “The Magic Pudding”, using puppets from the Marionette Theatre of Australia’s stage production. Explores the background to the writing of the story and looks behind the scenes of Australia’s national puppet theatre. Concludes with characters on stage at the Sydney Opera House. Presenter: Richard Bradshaw.

results.title: Printer light play
results.brief_description: A study on the technical properties of film colour. Shot on Eastman colour negative, the film records a variety of combinations of the printer lights, blue, red and green, thus creating different colour effects with the subject, a boy holding a Kodak colour control card.
